author: John von Neumann
summary: Von Neumann acknowledges receipt of a letter and reports having sent Kaufmann's work with his critical comments back to Kaufmann, noting significant mathematical errors including forgotten principles and an implausible solution to the continuum problem. He expresses gratitude to Professor Weyl for kindness shown during a prize competition matter and offers to collect proofs in Zurich at the end of September.
title: Regarding Kaufmann's Continuum Problem Solution
